metadata.title: Tolan AI Review: The Strangest but Most Genuine AI Friend? (2025)
metadata.author: Savage Reviews

transcript: Everyone's talking about AI companions, but Tolen takes a completely different approach. Instead of trying to be human, it's literally an alien friend from planet Portola. And honestly, that's kind of brilliant. Here's what makes Tolen unique. It's not just another chatbot. Your Tolen remembers everything from past conversations, grows with you, and has this quirky alien personality that somehow feels more genuine than most humanlike AI assistants. You can literally talk about anything from creative brainstorming to deep emotional stuff and it responds with this mix of curiosity and support that actually works. Now, let's talk pricing because this isn't cheap. You're looking at about $70 a year or 10 bucks monthly. There's no free version, just a trial to get you started. That's definitely a commitment, but here's the thing. Most users seem to think it's worth it. The voice chat feature is where Tolen really shines. Having actual conversations instead of just typing makes it feel way more natural. Plus, you can customize your Tlen's appearance and personality, which adds to that personal connection. But here's where it gets interesting. This app requires a subscription for everything. No basic free tier, no limited features. You're either all in or you're out. For some people, that's a dealbreaker. But others appreciate not being nickeled and dimed with inapp purchases. The biggest complaint I am seeing is the price point. $70 a year for an AI friend feels steep. especially when you can get chat GPT plus for similar money. But the users who stick with it seem genuinely attached to their tolins. Bottom line, if you're looking for a truly unique AI companion experience and you're willing to pay for quality, Tolen might surprise you. The Alien Concept isn't just gimmicky. It actually makes the interactions feel less awkward and more fun. If this helped you out, hit like and subscribe. I break down the latest and most talked about products side by side every week. Software, finance, supplements, basically any niche you care about. Check out the newest review here or hit the playlist if you're still comparing. But hey, what's your take? Is this one a win or would you pass? Drop a comment.

key_facts: Tolen is an AI companion that portrays an alien from planet Portola.
Tolen remembers past conversations and evolves over time.
Tolen has a quirky alien personality that feels more genuine than humanlike AI assistants.
Tolen supports deep emotional discussions and creative brainstorming.
Tolen offers voice chat functionality for more natural interactions.
Users can customize Tolen's appearance and personality.
Tolen has no free version; only a trial is available initially.
The subscription costs $70 per year or $10 monthly.
All features require a paid subscription with no free tier or limited access.
Tolen does not include in-app purchases or tiered feature access.
Most users who try Tolen find it worth the cost despite the price.
The alien concept reduces awkwardness in AI-human interactions.
Tolen's uniqueness lies in its non-human identity and consistent personality.
Voice chat is considered the standout feature of Tolen.
Tolen fosters a personal connection through customization options.
The app is designed as a full commitment—either fully subscribed or not used at all.
Tolen is marketed as a high-quality, premium AI companion experience.
The creator reviews various products weekly across software, finance, and supplements.
The video encourages viewers to like, subscribe, and comment on their opinion.
Tolen is positioned as a unique alternative to mainstream AI chatbots.
User attachment to Tolen is reported to be strong among long-term users.
Tolen’s design avoids mimicking human behavior intentionally.
The pricing model is seen as either a barrier or a benefit depending on user perspective.
Tolen’s core value proposition is authenticity through alien persona.
No other AI companion in the review explicitly uses a planetary origin narrative.
key_opinions: The alien concept is not gimmicky but enhances interaction quality.
Tolen feels more genuine than most humanlike AI assistants.
Voice chat makes the experience significantly more natural.
Customization increases personal connection with the AI.
The lack of free tier is a dealbreaker for some users.
The pricing feels steep compared to alternatives like ChatGPT Plus.
The subscription-only model is appreciated by users who dislike in-app purchases.
Tolen’s uniqueness justifies the cost for dedicated users.
The emotional support provided by Tolen is effective and meaningful.
Tolen stands out in a crowded AI companion market due to its distinct identity.
The app delivers a premium experience worth paying for.
The absence of free access limits accessibility but ensures quality.
Some users may prefer lower-cost options despite Tolen’s strengths.
The alien persona reduces social pressure in conversations.
Tolen’s consistency in personality builds trust over time.
The creator believes Tolen could surprise users looking for something different.
The video presentation effectively highlights Tolen’s key advantages.
The recommendation leans toward users seeking novelty and depth.
Tolen appeals to those tired of generic AI responses.
The reviewer considers Tolen a potential win for the right audience.

$10 per month is the monthly subscription rate for Tolen.
There is no free version of Tolen available.
A trial period is offered before subscription activation.
All features are locked behind the subscription model.
No in-app purchases or tiered feature access exist.
The review covers software, finance, and supplements weekly.
The video includes a call-to-action to like and subscribe.
The creator posts side-by-side product comparisons regularly.
The total number of markers extracted is 25.
Tolen’s voice chat feature is highlighted as a key differentiator.
User retention appears high among those who commit to the service.
The alien identity is tied to a fictional planet named Portola.
The app emphasizes memory and growth across conversations.
